text: Nontron () is a commune and a sub-prefecture of the Dordogne department in the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region, southwestern France. It is the capital of the northernmost arrondissement of the Dordogne department. The Nontronite is a mineral (a silicate mineral) rich in iron named after Nontron. ==Geography== Nontron has an area of and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The commune is in the centre of the Regional Natural Park Périgord Limousin (). Nontron and its neighboring communes Nontron is surrounded by the communes Le Bourdeix, Augignac, Savignac-de-Nontron, Saint- Pardoux-la-Rivière, Sceau-Saint-Angel, Saint-Martial-de-Valette and Saint- Martin-le-Pin. ==Population== The inhabitants of Nontron are known, in French, as Nontronnais (women: Nontronnaises). With a population of 3,151 (2014), Nontron has a population density of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Nontron, formed by 5 communes with a population of 4,653 inhabitants (2013) and an area of . ==Administration== Nontron is a subprefecture of the Dordogne and the capital of the arrondissement of Nontron. The commune is the administrative centre () of the Périgord Vert Nontronnais canton formed by 28 communes.
